ZM
Coping Strategies
2 hours ago

How to manage anxiety during work meetings

I've been struggling with anxiety during team meetings. Sometimes I feel my heart racing and find it hard to speak up. I worry that others will notice I'm anxious, which makes me even more anxious.

Has anyone found effective techniques that help in the moment? I've tried deep breathing before meetings, but once I'm in there, I sometimes forget to use my coping strategies.

Would love to hear what's worked for others, especially in professional settings where you need to appear confident.

12 Replies

KL
KL
1 hour ago

I've found the 5-4-3-2-1 grounding technique really helpful in meetings. When I start to feel anxious, I identify 5 things I can see, 4 things I can touch, 3 things I can hear, 2 things I can smell, and 1 thing I can taste. It helps bring me back to the present moment.

BT
BT
2 hours ago

I prepare notes before meetings and practice what I want to say. Having something written down helps me feel more confident, even if I don't end up looking at my notes. Also, I try to speak up early in the meeting - getting over that first hurdle makes the rest easier.

ZM
ZM
1 hour ago

That's a great idea about speaking up early! I never thought about how the anxiety builds the longer I wait. I'll definitely try that in my next meeting.
